Legal_Issue: Whether fear of persecution due to a blood feud constitutes a Convention refugee claim
Application_Facts: Applicant feared murder due to a blood feud involving his family; claimed his family constitutes a 'particular social group' under Canon of Leke
Decision_Outcome: Application for Convention refugee status denied
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Immigration and Refugee Board's decision
Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review dismissed; no reviewable error found
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution based on membership in a particular social group (family) due to blood feud
Legal_Standard: A Convention refugee must have a well-founded fear of persecution for reasons of race, religion, nationality, membership in a particular social group, or political opinion
Assessment_Factor: Nature of threat (criminal vs. persecutory), state protection, social group definition
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of administrative decision by Immigration and Refugee Board
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard; presence of reviewable error
Evidence_Used: Applicant's testimony regarding blood feud, cultural context of Canon of Leke
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 96 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to blood feud and alleged membership in a particular social group
Evidence_Assessed: Board assessed whether the blood feud amounted to persecution under the Convention
Governing_Rule: Persecution must be for a Convention reason; criminal feuds not automatically qualifying
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to establish that the blood feud was persecution linked to a protected ground
Outcome: Application dismissed; no refugee status granted
Harm_Assessment: Risk of murder due to blood feud
Cause_Description: Applicant feared being killed due to a family blood feud and sought refugee protection
Evidence_Handling: Board evaluated evidence linking the threat to a Convention ground
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient evidence that the threat was due to a protected ground under the Convention
Evidence_Assessment: Threat attributed to criminal activity, not state-persecution or protected grounds
Decision_Rationale: Fear stems from criminality (blood feud), not persecution for a Convention reason; family not recognized as a particular social group in this context
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of nexus between harm and a Convention ground
Legal_Standard_Applied: Well-founded fear of persecution on Convention grounds
